hey guys. right im new to the mounting stuff so can you give me some help. i downloaded powerISO but don't know where i the image is and where i mount it to. can you guys give me a brief discription on how i make it work and im sure it will help people like me in the future.

I use Deamon Tools Lite its free form here:
http://www.daemon-tools.cc/eng/products/dtLite
Download the free version.

1: Install Daemon Tools Lite [may have to restart]

2: Install DTGadget from within the setup         [win7/vista]
3: Mount the base game 'iso' image either with the 'DTGadget' or 'Daemon Tools Lite'
4: Go through the setup process

5: Find the keygen, which is located on the base game iso you mounted .example [F:/] or [D:]
6: Generate a key and use it.

Continue to do this process for each expansion pack.

Ok, I spent the morning and afternoon installing this per the instructions listed by Badman959 and after finishing his instructions I got the same error that most everyone seemed to be getting about them not being able to verify my copy. 

Finally I uninstalled everything and used the website provided by Beves50 and THAT worked. I used all of the .iso and files provided in this torrent, EXCEPT for the cracks and instruction which I used from that website. The only thing that they don't mention on that other website is after you install the base game in this torrent you'll need to install the update provided in this torrent as well. Then continue on with generations and the rest of the expansions and stuff packs.

As for the people who're getting the "disk not found" error. -IF- the instructions for Badman959 will work for you, you're going to have to mount the generations .iso to play the game, but like I said, it didn't matter a flip to me because I got a different error instead, but you can at least try if you've already did the install that way and maybe you'll get lucky.

Thanks to Beves50 for sharing that link!
Oh, and I also used the World Adventures expansion that Badman posted as well. So far everything seems to be working well, fingers crossed. :)
